notesStmt.note: Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active 1575-1624): inscribed with his name (folio 52v); see William Popper, The Censorship of Hebrew Books (New York: KTAV Publishing House, 1969), p. 61, and appendix § 62-74. Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1618 (folios 14r, 52r); see William Popper, The Censorship of Hebrew Books (New York: KTAV Publishing House, 1969), pp. 100-101, and appendix § 80-84.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, marked with catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Meshareth Mosheh, Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional Ms. 17,057.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849), London bookseller; bought by the British Museum from him at Macdonald's sale, lot 174, on 23 October 1847: inscribed, folio [54v] (fse002v).
